site_name: NAVAJO NATION ZOO AND BOTAN PK

citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
The facility representative indicated they were unable to locate the following records: program of veterinary care, avian
environment enhancement plan, and disposition records for one common raven and two budgies. Inability to access
required records at licensed facilities impedes APHIS officials' ability carry out official duties. Each exhibitor shall during
business hours, allow APHIS officials to examine records required to be kept by the Act and the regulations.
Correct by 20 February 2026.

The facility representative stated that one common raven escaped during transport of birds to a temporary holding facility
to conduct maintenance work on the primary enclosure. During transport, the door of a transport enclosure popped open
when it was inadvertently jostled, allowing the bird to escape. Recovery attempts were made but were unsuccessful.
Failure to recapture an animal may result in harm or death to the animal. Handling of animals shall be done as carefully
as possible to minimize risk of harm to the animal and so as to assure the safety of the animal.
Correct from this date forward of 21 January 2026.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.126(a)(2) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
The facility representative indicated they were unable to locate the following records: program of veterinary care, avian 
environment enhancement plan, and disposition records for one common raven and two budgies. Inability to access 
required records at licensed facilities impedes APHIS officials' ability carry out official duties. Each exhibitor shall during 
business hours, allow APHIS officials to examine records required to be kept by the Act and the regulations. 
 
Correct by 20 February 2026. 
2.131(b)(1)  Critical
   
Handling of animals. 
The facility representative stated that one common raven escaped during transport of birds to a temporary holding facility 
to conduct maintenance work on the primary enclosure. During transport, the door of a transport enclosure popped open 
when it was inadvertently jostled, allowing the bird to escape. Recovery attempts were made but were unsuccessful. 
Failure to recapture an animal may result in harm or death to the animal. Handling of animals shall be done as carefully 
as possible to minimize risk of harm to the animal and so as to assure the safety of the animal. 
 
Correct from this date forward of 21 January 2026. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
